eerhardt commented on pull request #5931: ARROW-7289: [C#] ListType constructor argument is redundant
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5931#discussion_r352876537
 
 

 ##########
 File path: csharp/src/Apache.Arrow/Types/ListType.cs
 ##########
 @@ -25,10 +25,16 @@ public sealed class ListType : ArrowType
         public Field ValueField { get; }
         public IArrowType ValueDataType { get; }
 
-        public ListType(Field valueField, IArrowType valueDataType)
+        public ListType(Field valueField)
         {
             ValueField = valueField ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(valueField));
+            ValueDataType = ValueField.DataType;
+        }
+
+        public ListType(IArrowType valueDataType)
 
 Review comment:
   Can this constructor just call into the constructor above? Similar to the way it works in C++:
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/81909dc0775a686cb8d89037dc96d2cd78e01a1e/cpp/src/arrow/type.h#L591-L597

 @@ -25,10 +25,16 @@ public sealed class ListType : ArrowType
         public Field ValueField { get; }
         public IArrowType ValueDataType { get; }
 
-        public ListType(Field valueField, IArrowType valueDataType)

eerhardt commented on pull request #5931: ARROW-7289: [C#] ListType constructor argument is redundant
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5931#discussion_r353256348
 
 

 ##########
 File path: csharp/src/Apache.Arrow/Types/ListType.cs
 ##########
 @@ -25,10 +25,16 @@ public sealed class ListType : ArrowType
         public Field ValueField { get; }
         public IArrowType ValueDataType { get; }
 
-        public ListType(Field valueField, IArrowType valueDataType)
+        public ListType(Field valueField)
         {
             ValueField = valueField ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(valueField));
+            ValueDataType = ValueField.DataType;
+        }
+
+        public ListType(IArrowType valueDataType)
+        {
             ValueDataType = valueDataType ?? NullType.Default;
 
 Review comment:
   I don't see this behavior in either the C++ or Java implementation.
   
   I'd say it is up to you whether to leave the Field constructor as-is, or change it to throw on a `null` type. I could go either way on it.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
[https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/csharp/src/Apache.Arrow/Types/ListType.cs#L28]

 

The ListType constructor has two arguments but 'ValueDataType' can be determined by 'Filed.DataType' and 'ValueFiled' can be created by valueDataType.

It seems to me that the constructor should be separated to "ListType(Field valueField)" and " ListType(IArrowType valueDataType)".
